reviews.review_msg: Unfortunately, stacks up as one of my least favorites. I found his lectures very disorganized, and his stance slightly unclear. Recommend al alternate teacher for this class
great

SA150 NOW/ Straightforward slides, no laptops, gives layouts for MT/ Finals, not afraid to veer off topic to discuss tangential information while being PC but also expressive. Participation marks  asking questions in class. Lectures reflect textbook chapters with a little extra

Most of the bad reviews are from first years who received bad marks because they didn't follow the rubrics, so don't trust those. Crage was a good prof and the assignments were all straight forward. Marking depends on the TA but we had open book exams that were super easy as long as you have good notes.

Professor Crage was an awesome prof. Her assignment guidelines were easy to follow and clear. She was always available to answer questions. Her exams were fair and nothing was a surprise. The textbook was very easy to follow as well. I would love to take a class with her again.

I enjoyed Dr. Crage's class. Like others have said, both the workload and concepts were easy. Also you can skim thru the readings. Instead of lecs, she gave us notes each week (which were easy to follow through) and weekly recap videos/links to Youtube vids so it wasn't time consuming. If you stay on track & do the weekly discussions you'll do fine

I enjoyed this class a lot honestly. The workload was super easy & the material was interesting. Discussions & essays were very clear and simple. Grading was fair. Lots of ppl complained but it's obvious they didn't even try at all. Just as long as you stay on track, do the readings, & ask for help when unclear, you'll get a good grade.

I don't recommend taking an asynchronous class (no set times) with Dr Crage. Lots of textbook reading that was expected, but also "video lectures" that were unclear and only about 10 minutes long a week, and some weeks didn't even have one. She doesn't answer questions clearly, and midterm/finals are kinda rough even though it's open book.

Unclear instructions. Low quality of teaching but have high expectation on you. Her textbooks definition of some terms are so confusing, you will be using Google more than using your textbook and her lecture to learn.

As a 1st year student, I liked Dr. Crage. Her TA's really do all the marking for essays so that's where most communication happens. Both she and the TA are accessible and will provide feedback upon request. Dr. Crage is sometimes a little unclear for questions, But nothing you cant clarify upon. No issues with this prof, she knows her stuff.

if you're good at being independent, take her. good at giving instructions, and helping if you ask for it; discussions and essays are quick and easy if u read the textbook; lots of students were crying about her for no reason. just mad that uni is harder than high school. she's not perfect, but she's definitely good so don't let comments scare you.

Suzanna gave clear instructions for assignments/exams. Discussion posts and essays were also not hard. As long as you read the textbook, which is fairly short, you'll do fine. Was in a group chat with lots of first year's and they hated on Suzanna for not holding their needy hands through it, hence the negative comments. Ignore them, she's good.

The class isnt too difficult and material is all based off of textbook and module readings, so be ready to read about 20 pages a week plus weekly discussions. Only thing is that she tries to be humorous in her responses but they come off rude and insensitive in my opinion. Or she beats around answering your questions so no straight forward answers

Not sure why she has bad reviews as it was overall an enjoyable class as concepts were easy to understand and pretty much high-school level. The 2 essay's were fairly simple and were graded fairly, but make sure to be on track with the class as there are weekly discussions. Would recommend as a GPA booster!

Prof was not organized and the course was a mess. Messed up my grade and I had to email the prof to ask her for a breakdown of my grade and she emailed me back that there was a mistake made and she will fix it. Had I not emailed her my grade would have suffered. I had also emailed the TA about the issue, she replied to me telling me a different %.

Weekly readings/discussions, 2 essays, 2 midterms (cumulative). Not an equal playing ground for everyone as there's a ton of TAs, depending on how helpful your TA is can benefit your success or not. Crage is unorganized with her way of setting up readings and instructions. Cant answer questions clearly, if anything, leaves us more confused.

Loved this class, the online format is super easy to follow and keep track of weekly discussions and readings. the content itself is very interesting and applicable to current events The TAs take a while for grades but the class size was huge. The prof is super knowledgable and the textbook she provides is really helpful

Super nice prof! She's really sweet and tries to help as much as she can. We have weekly discussions, 2 essays, a midterm and a final. The midterm was incredibly easy, as long as you know the people, terms, concepts and whatnot, you'll do fine in this class. Also depends on the TA.

Seems pretentious, keeps mentioning about how shes from America and lives in dt Vancouver every class. Poor communication skills, kept emailing her and shed take days or weeks to reply or sometimes she wont even reply. Her guidelines for essays arent clear. The course is pretty straightforward tho. She doesnt post slides so go to class

I liked attending lecture, the readings were easy to get through. The exams were fair and not too hard as long as you attend tutorial and read the weekly readings. My TA was the sweetest, shes probably why I did well. The papers were also easier and more fun to write than standard assignments. But no posted slides. Im actually usually a B student

Dr. Crage is really nice and accessible outside class... and that's about it. Her lectures are extremely boring, so much so that you can't possibly stay focused after half an hour. Also, attendance is mandatory for lectures, even though they're super disorganized and off-topic sometimes. You pretty much have to rely on tutorials and the textbook.

When I took this course, the prof would go on tangents off topic from the proposed lecture, and would explicitly state that many parts of her lecture slides werent going to be on the exam. Tutorials are key as they do a wonderful job summarizing the readings and topics, and state what should likely be on exams. Summary: tutorials are important.

Professor Crage seems like a nice person, but she is extremely disorganized and it really affects the quality of learning. The lectures were boring and it was annoying that she wouldn't post the slides. The textbook was written by her so you're pretty much just hearing one perspective for the entire course. I'm completely turned off of sociology.

Crage is a nice prof who provides a somewhat easy course. The material is pretty sraight forward. Her tests arent bad. The lectures are marked for attendance and are the most boring things in the world. If not graded for lectures i would not attend any.

If you do the readings before class like she suggests all the course compents make complete sense and fit together well. The readings teach basic components, which are expanded upon through examples in lecture and tutorial. - no laptopsis true, but she goes through the notes slowly and there isnt alot to write down - exams were very fair
Don't take this class if you like using laptops, she literally will not let you take notes on a laptop. Her lectures are boring and she talks a lot.

marks are taken off if you don't go to lecture. book, lecture, and tut often feel like 3 different classes. Tests material that appear only in one component. Tutorial is extension of lecture, book, and new material discussion. super restricting guidelines on papers, but tests are fair with some odd stupid specific questions. easy class conceptually
Pay attention, do the readings and show your effort. You need a readiness to learn. Chat with her if you are confused, she is super approachable.

Lectures are definitely necessary as both midterms and the final had questions discussed only in lecture and not in the textbook. Although she is a bit disorganized, she is a really sweet person. Definitely ask her for help if you need it as she is extremely helpful and friendly!

As a Business student taking this course as an elective was a vital mistake,Suzanna is a friendly prof, however her course is a lot tougher than you think. For starters she tests material from her lectures, making attendance mandatory and makings readings required as well. She also doesnt allow any electronics of any kind. Be ready for dry lectures

Suzanna seems like a really nice person, but her lectures are quite disorganized and boring  as she doesnt have lecture notes so it's all based on her thoughts at the time. Definitions were glossed over and mostly focused on real world applications.  If you have a good TA, it really helps. Luckily I did so the tutorials were really interesting!

Suzanna makes easy concepts more difficult than they need to be. Her exams are difficult as the wording is confusing. Essays are difficult as well, there is no outline that you can go off of. For a first year course putting in some effort should be enough to get a least a B, but not in this class.

Textbook about 15-20 pages per week. Tutorial goes over textbook while lecture adds more content to reading. Not allowed to use electronics in class, will dock percentage off if caught. Passionate and expects you to participate in lecture. Final + midterms easy if paid attention to readings and class. 2 essays only, given lots of time to do them.

How can you do a lecture on racism in Canada without mentioning what Aboriginal are put through in Canada?? She is very clearly American, and seems unaware of her audience. Thank god the textbook is free as it is littered with mistakes. Mandatory attendance is useless since lectures do not actually teach you anything new.
She's okay but attendance is useless but mandatory

Ridiculous mandatory attendance system. Inefficient and you lose 1% per absence. How she talks is preachy and annoying. I try to tune it out. lectures are extremely boring. Tutorials are okay. Tests are unfair. Uses her own textbook. No electronics. Take it if you're a 1st year with no clue about the world not with this prof though

The course book isn't too hard to read, and it lines perfectly up with her lectures. Her tests are designed so you can incorporate textbook material or lecture material  on her exams. She gives a study that matches up to what is discussed in class and in the text. If you use the guide  the tests are simple. plus she is really hot.

Just read the book and take good notes. The midterm is based off the book and examples discussed in class, so as long as you do the review and have a good grasp on all the material you should pass with flying colors. Everyone on here that is crying about it being unfair or extremely hard is probably just upset because they didn't work hard enough.

Doesn't provide very useful in-class notes, considering that attendance to class is mandatory. "Reviews" before exams aren't helpful, but tutorials are great. Would recommend going to tutorials seeing as how they were more helpful than the lectures.

Gives only 2 attendance passes otherwise 1% grade taken off final grade for every other missed lecture and tutorial. Content was fairly easy. Exams were tricky. Tough grader. No laptops allowed, minimal slides in class and doesn't post them online. You basically absolutely have to go to every single class and pay attention to pass.
She can go off topic and doesn't allow any devices and does not post her lectures online. Beware.
Rebecca lacks communication skills, and her lessons are long and boring. AVOID.

The only graded materials were two exams, an essay, and tut participation, making one bad grade difficult to recover from. Your TA marks your work and mine was a very tough grader and not clear with the guidelines for full marks. But tutorials were helpful in understanding the material, and the lecture gave the basics but it was not as in-depth.

Rebecca was quite boring in my opinion, and I felt that the content evaluated on the midterm and final did not accurately reflect my understanding of the course. The evaluations were graded rather tough for my section, and I felt that her quality of teaching was below standard.

This course is difficult and boring. I am not kidding you! Fortunately, Rebecca is so sweet and caring. She supported me when I felt overwhelmed and stressed. I thought I would get a F at the beginning but I started to be confident over time. Finally I got a C! I am not good at Sociology but I am still pleased with the outcome. Thank you Rebecca!
Good! very standard prof, clear expectations and tests/assignments are straight forward.
Best prof I had so far. Dr. Lennox is such a kind person and very patient as well. Her teachings are clear and very thorough. Really recommend her

Dr. Travers was my very first professor back from my SFU days and it's only in hindsight that i can reflect on how much brainwashing there was? Rather than focusing on sociology we were literally told a million times over that there are no biological differences between women + men in sports, which is obviously untrue and is harmful to women+girls

Textbook readings you can skim, just be able to expand on learning objectives, weekly discussions were graded very harshly, two papers were graded fairly, final exam was fair. Really depends on your TA, not much communication with TA throughout semester and was a tough grader for weekly discussions, easier distance ed electives include educ classes

Taking this course online we had little to no communication with the actual professor. All of our communication was with the TM, Anna Maslouskaya. She was wonderful, very helpful, very responsive whenever we had a question. Most of the work involves keeping up with weekly forum discussions for participation marks, I highly recommend doing these!!
Ann is the best professor I have ever had. You get what you put into the course. If you do the work at are engaged in the class you can come out of every day a better and wiser individual.

Amazing professor, she's also really funny if you aren't easily offended. Textbook is very dry and her lecture slides are essentially pictures, so be sure to listen. She is very engaging and hilarious so it won't be difficult paying attention.

Awesome Prof! Showing up to lecture isn't really necessary since the midterms are all terms that are in the book. It's a 4 credit course but seems like a three credit course since there isn't even much course load or anything too complicated about it. If you want your life to be less harsh for your first year take this class with her!
Very passionate and engaging prof! She does not post lecture slides to encourage you to come to lecture, so make sure you do attend, and take down notes. The midterms and final project were fair.

Loved going to the lectures and the tutorials. Its a super interesting and relevant class. Go to the lectures and the essay for the midterm will be a breeze and know your definitions for the short answer questions from the textbook. Highly recommend taking this class

Excellent Professor! Lectures are awesome, very interesting and relevant to everyday life. Tutorials do not have mandatory attendance, but I found them to be very helpful for the tests and interesting as well.  Textbook is pretty helpful but you could get by with out it. Highly recommend taking SA 150 with Travers.

Great prof! Loved coming to the lectures and the tutorials! Midterms are fair. Attend all the lectures and the essay will be a breeze. For the short answers make sure to know your definitions that are in the textbook

A really nice person. Easily approachable since she doesn't have a condescending vibe. Lectures are not really informative. Mostly open discussion and she usually gives HUGE hints to "possible" exam questions. Tutorials are good for getting the terms and key points down to memory through discussion. But they are not mandatory. Great prof and class
Tutorials aren't graded, 8:30 tutorial is not worth it. sleep in and you'll still do fine.

She secretly forces her feminist views on you while saying she wants to learn from us also. Shes relatively easy, but tough if you want to have something remarked. Midterm was straight forward, but you actually do have to attend lecture, tutorial, and read text consistently.

Open to questions, a fair marker, and clearly passionate about sociology. She's good but she tends to jump from topic to topic. She also leaves her powerpoint slides vague so textbook is essential but she's a straightforward examiner (hint: she basically gives away the exam questions!). She's funny too! Highly recommend her for a 1st-year course

Ann is really passionate about her subject and she understands that first year courses shouldn't be treated the same as fourth year ones. She makes an effort to get to know her students. Readings were relevant and midterms were straight forward and she even gives essay topics before hand. Great class to take when trying to get a feel for university

AMAZING teacher. She interacts with the class and makes it interesting. The two midterms were VERY easy... She gave us the essay topics ahead of time, and there were only a few short answer questions. Overall great class.
Unbelievably amazing professor. I loved going to class and listening to her speak. She is also very approachable and kind. Just attend class, try to participate, and you will do fine!

Ann is easily one of my favorite profs! She's always open to different opinions and constantly tries to engage the class in the topic discussions. The material was pretty easy but make sure you go to class since she highlights what will be on the tests :)

Ann was awesome. I sat in her front row every class with a friend and after two lectures she started calling us her special front row. She's super nice and always picks up her cell phone! Do the readings and make sure you go to lecture!

Ann is awesome, best part of the course for me. She came round at the beginning of the course and introduced herself to me and we had a nice chat, she does little things like that which help to make everyone more comfortable.

Hands down best professor in the Sociology department. She was very clear and her lectures were very organized and engaging. She made my first year a lot more bearable with her straight forward midterms

Her lectures were not clear and she's very vague. She jumps from topics to topics. You will have to listen carefully to what she says because she does not allow laptops and she barely uses a ppt. At times, she will call on people to participate in questions. The test is mostly based on the textbook. Must get the textbook!
Good lectures, she lets you know the essay questions for the tests in advance. Over all no complaints.

Her lectures are well organized, easy to follow and uses her own experiences to relate to the course material. Only downside to the course is the fact that she uses cue cards to call on people. You are more than welcome to "pass" but you're still put on the spot! Otherwise, great course overall.

What I like about Ann, is that she has immense enthusiasm for Sociology, and her special topic of Sport in Sociology. But, she throws a lot of her opinions at you for critical thinking analysis. I think she indirectly wants you to adopt her opinions. Her powerpoints are also a little vague so reading the textbook is vital to succeed in this course.

Awesome prof, so open minded and FAIR. Really fair, if you put in effort you get a good mark. Love how you can re-submit exams becasue her TA's are ridiculous and useless but if you make a fair argument she bumps your grade. Loved this class learned a lot, not difficult only 2 relitivly easy midterms if you study and one project.Ann was great

This was an awesome class! It was really interesting and quite easy. Attend lectures and you should be good for the exams. Her midterms were super easy and she practically hands you the test questions!

Ann is an amazing person and prof. She is passionate, loving what she does, and it shows. Midterms were incredibly fair, though marking on the essay portion was VERY inconsistent. Final was a take-home poster project which was marked very easily and you are given a lot of room to do whatever you want. Not a fan of sociology, but it was a good class

Ann is an amazing person and prof. She is passionate, loving what she does, and it shows. Midterms were incredibly fair, though marking on the essay portion was VERY inconsistent. Final was a take-home poster project which was marked very easily and you are given a lot of room to do whatever you want. Not a fan of sociology, but it was a good class
Absolute crap. She forces your views on you, whether you know it or not. Much of her material is biased and her guest speakers is even worse. But she is definitely an easy professor.

Friendly and communicative, but narrowly focused for an intro class. We mostly discussed the topics she deemed to be most important (gender roles and sports). Limited focus turned me off of sociology. Also, if you have a bad TA (as I did), go to Ann and she will help you and be fair).

So many reasons why not to take the class with this prof: she is not a fair marker, says the class is not curved yet 95% is an A+, has certain views and if you dont side with them dont expect to do well in her class, and there are much better profs you could take this class with. BEWARE!!!

Wow, she is one amazing prof.  Very interesting and encourages in-class discussions.  Just study from her notes and read over the text once and you're set.  I'm looking forward to taking her courses in the future!

Absolutely amazing prof! She doesn't rely much on the text...make sure you show up to class and take good, detailed notes, since that is exactly what's on the exams. She brings up several extremely interesting and thought-provoking subjects that are much more exciting than the boring dribble that comes out of an introductory text.

Travers is really nice and provides fun and interesting lectures. SA 150 is a very easy course, everything is pretty much in the text book. Overall great course and great Prof. I highly recommend this course as GPA booster.
She is amazing!

Ann is one of the best professors at SFU! she is compelling, insightful, inspirational and interesting! I loved this class, Ann was also my TA, I never missed a class or tutorial because they were so interesting! More profs should be like Ann!

One of the best profs I've had and I only took the course for an elective.  Very interesting class and presentation of material.  Tests easy but marks papers fairly hard.  Still easier than most classes.  Oh and her son is adorable!! ;)  She's inspired me to take more Sociology classes and I would love to take anything with her again.

She is inspiring, a great speaker. I took SA 150 my very first semester at SFU. I have so much respect for her. Final exam was a take-home essay. Can't complain there. A briliant mind. Oh and once she brought her son to class he was such a cutie.
No Comments

She's a great teacher!!Her exams weren't too bad. Tutorials helped to clarify more since I asked for my TA's help a lot, rather than her's, just because my TA was right there. Luv her take home essay for finals!!Great proffff!!!

Ann is a fantastic prof that inspires students. Course material very interesting and sometimes a bit controversial, which creates fantastic discussions. She delivers material very effectively and is kind towards students. Easy midterms, but you must go to every class, as a lot of the content is from her lectures.

The best class I've ever taken. Really interesting topics. Exteremely insightful. I don't even feel like I'm learning. Anne is such a funny professor too. She's very good at delivering points and forming discussions. Her midterms and finals are more than fair.

I took this course only because it fit nicely in my schedule. but I found out her classes are amazing! she really has a deep interest in what she is teaching and hey, she doesn't even need a mike because she speaks so clearly.
great prof!!! easy course, encourages class discussions and engages you. midterm essay questions are very obvious, read the text and study the bolded terms and you will get no less than a B.

Good course, get's you thinking & opens your mind to new ideas. So many times you end up thinking "Huh I don't really have that much evidence to support my argument, time to revise." Very biased though, maybe on purpose so as to shock and motivate but some is probably personal as well. Focus was on sex segregation in sports. She was anti.

good prof easy class as long as you follow what she says. doesnt seem like she likes anything that is against her views (feminist) even though she tells you to think for yourself. if you write something remotely **** on your tests be prepared to not do as well as you think

Go to class and listen because she provides no notes on webct or anything.  There are barely any notes in class either.  Very interesting class with Ann.  Lots of class discussions..and ya..it's mostly sports related.  Listen & watch what she specifically talks about b/c it's likely it will turn up on the midterm.  It's fair.  Study the terms.
Awesome
Agenda pusher who fails to hide it. Does a great job of indoctrinating young and weak minds.
most constructive class ive ever taken
Anne is a great prof who alwayz keeps me awake!  her class is very interactive and fun. Midterms are fairly hard but make sure you know how to incorporate sociological terms in her essays!

She's my favorite prof so far! Keeps you awake in class. Is very sports-oriented, but also open-minded. Doesn't use microphone, but that forces you to listen. Love her stories and I found the tests fair, but remember to use more sociological terms!
She was a funny person but her style of lecturing was not ideal.  It did not help that she did not wear a microphone or that she wasn't willing to repeat herself.  Ever.
it's not bad...her exams are quit hard...and she demands a lot form her students
I really enjoyed this class, she's a great prof and seems open to ideas that differ from her own.

Not a very good teacher for a first year class.  Her expectations were way too high and she was condescending and put down our work after the midterm.  I wouldn't recommend her for a first year class.
No Comments
No Comments
interesting teaching style, very interactive
interesting person.  Exams = relatively hard
She makes the two hour lectures entertaining and educational.
Best teacher i have ever had, her lectures were awesome!!
cool with crutches
Just not a very good prof in my opinion
Very nice, but weird interactive lecturing style with almost no content covered
No Comments
great sense of humor, very easy going

best proff. I have had at SFU. She is extremely helpful and encouraging. You do need to listen in lecture, because not everything appears in the notes. doesn't worry too much about details, but wants students to understand the big picture. this course is not very much work and she is a fair marker. the textbook is helpful but not necessary.

Amie was friendly and helpful if you visited her in office hours. However, her lectures lacked the structure I needed. She sat in lectures and talked about in-depth concepts while provided no notes (very difficult for first year students, especially). Her term project was very unclear, I felt like I had no idea what to write about. BAD TEXTBOOK!!!

She has high interest in the class and is very helpful in office hours. She has potential to be a great prof if she adjusts her presentation and provide more information on the slides. This course is interesting and really gets you thinking about this world. There is a lot to think about and that is why her notes do not suffice.

She needs to work more on her lecture notes! Meanwhile , her voice just make you want to fall a sleep. you have to do a lot of research online in order to get ready for her exams. You will fail her class, if you don't listen to what I said.

She is really nice and helpful if you see her during office hours. However, she basically gave no notes, you were supposed to talk notes off of what she lectured about, which I found extremely difficult to do, especially since its a first year course

She have great understanding of the subject by giving us numerous examples outside of the course materials. However, she often go off topic. I really liked her storybook project, it really gives the students something to look forward to besides the tedious essays that we expect in each course. I recommend her course! :)
Just understand her notes , you will do fine !  Don't even think about read the textbook.
She is really nice and her exams are more than reasonable if you study. I just wish she gave more detailed notes to copy down instead of just speaking the entire lecture

Amie's lectures are extremely unengaging. She doesn't post her lecture notes, making attendance mandatory. Her lecture notes, however, are completely threadbare and uninformative. So far the textbook has been my saviour. I do not recommend taking SA 150 with this prof.
You don't even need to attend lecture. I cannot begin with how useless her power point slides are. Her notes do not even correlate with the chapters of the textbook.

I truly enjoyed this class. Amie knows her stuff and she knows how to make it interesting for you. She's a passionate professor who engages students in the topics discussed. She uses very well-selected videos and articles (outside the textbook) to illustrate her points. Wish SFU had more professors like Amie.

Her inexperience really shows in lecture; she reads off her notes in lecture, but tends to stutter and sound very awkward. Makes it difficult to concentrate, especially at 8:30. Should put more information on her powerpoint slides to compensate.

Though a newer prof, Amie is great! Material was always delivered clearly and in an organized manner. She is very friendly, helpful, and approachable. Attendance is mandatory b/c notes & recordings do not go online. She goes over key concepts and themes, providing plenty of examples. Overall a very nice woman and a helpful prof.

She's a nice person, and will answer your Webct questions if they are directed at her, and your emails. The only really weird aspect to her is that she reads off of her notes in lecture, and get's nervous easily and flustered. BUT nobody is perfect! Otherwise, she's mostly a competent, and nice teacher!

She seems very nice, and tries hard to keep class interesting, but struggles to keep lectures informative. Wish she would rely more on her PowerPoint slides so we can copy notes down more effectively. Appears to read off a script of some sort, which is awkward. Exams are fair. I actually learned more in tutorials than in lecture, unfortunately...

Extremely nice professor and tries very hard to explain. and she's really pretty) =) One frdly note tho, I think she encourages TA to answer on WebCT but they are very incompetent. You ask a specific question and they point u to the text for a general def (duh, i would've chked prior to asking) so email her directly n don't bother posting on WebCT
He is an amazing prof, his real-life examples help relate to the topics a lot. I would highly recommend

Took his class even after reading all the bad reviews. Should've took them as a warning to not enrol instead of giving him the benefit of the doubt. Wordy slides, inconsistent and harsh grading (some TA's being easier markers than others). Barely scraped by in this class and I studied ALL the time (even went to office hours). Truly unfortunate.

As long as you do all the assigned work (read the textbook, participate in tutorials, review lectures), you will succeed. The midterm and final are all written, be prepared for that. Otherwise I love Kyle, he's a silly guy.

Kyle was a good prof. His lectures were good and the textbook was fairly easy to understand. I didnt really enjoy the material itself (im not a soc major) but he was a good prof. If u have this class as a requirement, Kyle is a good prof to take it with.

The prof is very enthusiastic about teaching but his lectures are incredibly unclear and hard to understand. The only way to learn the info is in tutorial. The lecture slides are almost useless. Many of the slides have no information or have way too much writing. After taking this course I don't think i'll willingly take sociology again.

Kyle is very passionate, kind, and funny. His lectures were engaging. Towards the end of his lectures there are usually a few slides with a lot of text, and on an off day he'd move through them quickly, but it generally didn't impede understanding. The exams were long; many students had trouble finishing them. Overall Kyle is a great lecturer:)

I hated this class. He is not a horrible professor, but his TAs are awful (or at least the one I got). I went to her for help on a specific part of my paper, and she said the part was great but gave me a bad mark on it. The TA was also no help at all in tutorials/emails and possibly had the most monotone voice.

He was engaging and passionate but often condescending and unapproachable. He gave us no information on what to expect on the midterm, and exams and paper were graded extremely tough. The readings are long and required thorough understanding, but tutorials were helpful to actually learn the course material and understand the readings.

he yells when he teaches so I rarely went. tutorials are mandatory and the TA's are rlly nice and engaging but they mark SO INSANELY HARD. rubric for the assignment didnt have any points on it, they just circle the letter grade you got with no explanation, and dont have office hours after to explain. if you dont have to, DONT TAKE THIS COURSE!

Kyle is a prof who is extremely well-versed and passionate about sociology. Yes, his exams are difficult (all written), but they are fully based on lectures and READINGS!! He sometimes uses words nobody understands. He only had a major paper and two exams. Honestly grading is all up to the TA. Overall a good class.

Avoid this prof at all costs he is terrible. The marking is super tough and the assignment was not clear at all. Kyle tries to make this lectures interesting by literally yelling and pacing around the lecture hall but its very annoying and doesn't help. He is also extremely rude and unapproachable in lecture and has a very condescending tone. AVOID

I don't understand the low ratings. His lectures were difficult to follow but reviewing it after class and putting in a decent amount of time to understand the material is also to be expected, especially for a 4 credit course. He's kind and offers extra office hours Do what you will with the 1/5 but don't let them scare u, put in effort and it's ok

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH KYLE! He is very forgetful and will often not respond to emails. The exams weren't even focused on lecture or textbook but on small things that he would talk or mention about during lecture. the grading horrible all depends on your TA. I heard the worst TA will be leaving this semester so that's probably a good thing.

Hardest course of the sem. Lots of reading. Midterm average was below 50%. Participation in tutorials matters - tutorials saved my life. Without them I would be screwed. You need to get lucky with TA otherwise getting good grades is tough. Prof is moody and unapproachable. Lecture slides have so much info and confusing content

the professor is an ok but talks way too fast and writes either way too much or way too little on his slides.
the class average for the midterm was 50%, he dosent tell you what to expect on the midterm or final 
it honestly depends on who your ta is because they do all the marking and basically re teach you all the important stuff...

your mark fully is dependent on what TA you get since they mark literally the midterm, essay, and final. Kyles a nice guy, but I wouldn't taking a course with him. the lecture slides are wordy, he moves a lot in class making it hard to follow and he talks fast. Doesn't give you any info of what to expect for the final, simply "study the material".

If hes your prof, find another time to do this course. The midterm average was 50%, he talks so much, moves around a LOT during his lectures, can be moody. This class requires you to KNOW AND FULLY do your readings otherwise your chance of doing well are very slim. Only took as a req, skip if you do not need, take a different course.

Took course in 2022, the reason why I'm majoring in Sociology! Lectures were engaging and entertaining & material wasn't too difficult. Keep up with the readings to succeed. Written assignments were fun. He is direct, but a kind and helpful professor. I encourage everyone to take a Sociology course, especially with Kyle if they have the option! :)
tests are absolutely ridiculous. Smallest details that aren't even mentioned in lecture and he'll mark u down "just because"....if u ask him why he says KNOW THE MATERIAL???

All depends on TA. It is ridiculous that the midterm average in my tutorial is lower than 40, and after we receive our grades, TA leisurely told us how her rating policies works. No one cares students succeed. If you are not a related major student, avoid this course.
I knew Dr. Willmott personally since I would visit him during his office hours. Dr. Willmott is reliable. Recommended.
W lecture skills. L everything else. PLEASE dedicate time to this class. ;(((((
do not care about the negative rate here as he is an AMAZING prof. These people just did not make the time to approach him I'd say. Otherwise he is very inspirational.
one of the profs I've come across. You'll never regret taking his class as he is extremely supportive.

Lectures and tutorials are engaging (I had Sarah who is great), you get a lot of help with the paper, and the tests are fair and straightforward. To do well, you need to make sure you can clearly explain the five main theories and the concepts discussed in lecture, and do all the readings. The tests are heavily based on the readings.

Kyle does not care about the class grades, nor do the TAs. The class average on the midterm was low 50s, and he doesn't do anything. Maybe change the way your TA's mark?? Not good with office hours and simply not very approachable. I took this course as an elective, and it was my hardest class, im not longer interested in Sociology.

TLDR; Passionate prof, unfair grading

The midterm and final are unfairly written and graded. All written answers, looking for you to write things that are not specified in the question. The TAs aren't forgiving either. Made me lose a lot of respect for his teaching style. Lectures are interesting and tutorials are helpful
worst course I've ever taken, huge differences in marking between TAs so the TA you have definitely makes a difference. Lecture slides were content heavy and often impossible to take notes on

Kyle is great, he speaks in a way that keeps your attention but there is so many words on the slides that it's so hard to follow because it sort of jumps around. For me, this class is horrendously difficult. For the midterms its all writing.

The class can be enjoyable. Lots of words on slides that makes it hard to follow while he talks. He's very particular about his midterm & final, you need to be VERY specific. Spend lots of time studying the textbook + notes, literally try to memorize EVERYTHING. Gave our class 'advice' on how to study, basically said "KNOW the answer." Obviously?..

His lectures were content heavy and the midterm and final exams were based on the textbook and lecture material. Slides had so much information on them so it was hard to follow along. The midterm and final had lots of questions on the articles so make sure you take good notes on the articles he mentions in class. Pre-readings are also in exams.

In his lectures Kyle moved really fast and his slides were very text-heavy.  Did not post the lecture slides in advance, but rather waited until after the class making it very difficult to follow along.  The TA's were all over the place, but I got luck with Yun Zhang who was an easy marker.  2 papers and 2 exams which solely rely on articles read.
Kyle does not care for you to succeed in this class. He goes through slides extremely fast and makes you feel dumb if you don't understand. Grading criteria very unclear.

Dr. Willmott is a decent professor and his lectures were somewhat engaging. He goes through the lecture slides very fast, which makes taking notes hard. SA 150, includes 1 paper, midterm, final and tutorial participation. The midterm was unnecessarily difficult, the class average for the exam was like 50 % and the exam was mostly on articles.

if ur TA is mary berger you won. made everything so easy, idk why ppl say he's rude, he rly is just quiet w/ dry humour. 1 paper, 2 exams & tut participation. exam 1 will be marked hard regardless, avg is always low, so don't worry abt that. read the readings (main ideas), and small definitions bc they will be on the exams. paper was fun.

I have mixed opinions on Kyle. He was hard, rude, and unwelcoming towards the beginning of the year, but at the end I weirdly was sad his lectures were done. He makes people feel dumb and scared in class. I found his tests easy and straightforward, he doesnt want you to fail. BUT Winnie is not a good TA. Marked so unfair and many people had issues.

Kyle is a very interesting guy. He seems intimidating at first but he is really a great guy who wants the best for you. Where things got tricky was how much he left up to the TAs. If you are like me and ended up with a bad TA good luck. There are two papers and two completely written exams, so everything is VERY subjective and all over the place.

I had them in my first semester of university, and he explained expectations exceptionally well. I learned a lot of skills I can carry on in my time here, so I am very thankful. Also, my TA, Yun Zhang, was incredible

Kyle is a really great prof. Although he comes off a bit intimidating at first, the way he presents material is straightforward and easy to understand. He also keeps the class engaged with memes in his slides and a break during lectures. The number of readings are also very fair where they are easy to understand and are pretty short.

He was okay. I found his lectures to be a bit boring but that may have just been my interest in the subject. He sends out his slides but says many important things that are not mentioned in the slides so make sure to write down what he is saying. My real issue with the course is the tutorials bc the TA's mark VERY hard. Read every article deeply!

Kyle is a great professor and makes SA extremely interesting. I have learned a lot from this class. Lectures were easy to listen to due to Kyle's passion for sociology. However, grading was really tough. Assignments were roughly graded and exams were difficult. Read the textbook and do all of the readings if you want to succeed.

Kyle attempts to make the class interesting. He is not personable and difficult to ask him questions. TA's all over the place and unhelpful. Wrote 2 papers and 2 tests. I liked the content but unfortunately the lack of support and help from the TA's ruined the class. Taught one thing then told it was wrong when I put it on the test or in my paper.

this course was a bit dry with it being FULL of definitions but Kyle did make it more enjoyable with his enthusiasm and his love for SA.  this is the hardest marked 100 level course I have ever taken. TAs mark very harshly with little feedback. As a 3rd-year whos an A student I really struggled.

Kyle was a great lecturer. His lectures got boring because sociology is pretty boring but he tried to liven it up with memes and his sense of humour. The issue I had with this class was my TA. If you get Ying Zhang (Winnie) as your TA switch out of that class immediately. The 2 hour tutorial with her, was pointless. She doesn't know how to grade SA
Uses LOTS of memes to teach. The tests are very difficult so is his grading.

Kyle was an AMAZING professor! He made me understand the content of SA150 really well!! He incorporates memes and GenZ type of content in the lecture, which I found really fun!! The only con is not Kyle himself, but rather the TAs. Holy- my TA gave my class a C average on our 1st assignment, which was unreasonable. Just pray you get a good TA tbh.

Dr. Willmott was a fantastic professor. His course is very organized and he makes every lecture super engaging due to his clear passion for the content. TAs are great and tutorials are really helpful for clarifying the sometimes complicated subject matter. Assignments are straight forward and he prepares you well for exams. Overall awesome class!

Funny guy, always brought in current events and memes into lectures to keep them entertaining. Class itself is fairly easy: 2 assignments, 2 tests. Explains things clearly and gives you hints about what might be on exams. Tutorials devote lots of time to preparing for assignments, which are also fairly easy.

Kyle is a fantastic lecturer, attended every lecture in person just because of how enjoyable his classes were. Kyle explains everything very simply and in an engaging manner. Cannot recommend him enough, also my TA was FANTASTIC, although a bit harsh for marking. overall amazing class, however not an easy A expect B range.

Dr. Willmott is fantastic. Every lecture is fascinating and he seems to really be passionate about the subject matter which makes class even better. His assignments and exams are pretty fair as long as you keep up with the readings and talk to your TA. He's got a great sense of humour and is just an overall cool guy. Can't recommend him enough.

Dr. Willmott is absolutely wonderful. His passion for the subject really comes through during his lectures! Super engaging lecturer and great sense of humour, loves making sociology memes. Course is a really great intro to sociology and his TAs are great! Assignments/tests are fair if you go to class and do the readings. Can't recommend enough!

The prof and TA's would mark everything so tough, without any explanation for why they marked you as poorly as they did. Additionally, for the final exam, it was all written answers and they gave out horrible grades to myself and all my peers and won't give you an opportunity to see your final exam???

Kyle is super funny and knowledgable and his lectures are amazing. The exams are short and long written answers only, but they prepare you well for this if you attend lecture and tutorials. His style of teaching is genuinely hilarious and you'll also learn a lot about sociology and different ways of thinking about the world. Highly recommend!!

I started out not liking the class because I didn't understand it, but soon grew to love it as the TA I had was amazing and the professor's lectures were informational and fun to listen to as the professor added some entertainment. Showing up to class is necessary and so are the readings, but worth it as it is straight forward.

Marking on the exams is insanely difficult. Tutorials are mandatory. content is not difficult but the TAs are  tough. In tutorial they say that you understand the concept perfectly, then when you carry that into the exam, it's wrong. The class will not be a GPA booster and the grade appeal process is extremely difficult.
assignments were more difficult but the lectures have memes and are worth it

It's easy to pay attention in his class, because he is engaging and charismatic. However, he delivers the content in a tacky, contradictory, and inflammatory way.  He makes it quite difficult to respect Sociology as an academic discipline, considering the hypocrisy imbedded in his lecture material.

Dr. WIllmott is an amazing professor! Very funny & knowledge guy during lectures & officer hours. But, this class is DIFFICULT. The tests are only composed of WRITTEN QUESTIONS. Tutorials are 2hrs & TA's mark harshly. Tips: Study lecture notes, talk in tutorials, attend lectures, & DO THE READINGS! Only 2 exams, 2 papers, & tutorial participation.

Lectures were amazing, interesting topics and very entertaining. He is very direct, clear with what he is looking for. Very little homework other than readings. Tests are a great format, as long as you understand the concepts clearly you'll do well, no random memorization. Great class, highly recommend

Professor Willmott is super funny and he seems like a really genuine caring dude. However all he does is talk about memes and real world social issues and assume you understand what he really is talking about. Lectures are a hit or miss, Tutorials are 2 hours long too and TA's are incredibly hard markers. Tutorials don''t prepare you for anything.

I do not recommend this class at all! He try's to be funny by using memes in class and trys to teach us with trends that are going on within the students and you won't understand it all. You have to participate in tutorials as its worth 15% of your grade. The test are all Written so you have to really understand the course.

Kyle is funny in lectures, but lecture attendance is very encouraged since the handwritten tests are super lecture content-specific. The TAs can also be pretty hard graders when writing papers with very lacking feedback. Tutorials are also do not help with prep for midterms or assignments.
Makes you work for it but extremely well organized and have amazing lectures.

Hands down one of my favorite profs at SFU. I originally took this course just for breadth but Kyle made the lectures extremely interesting and you will learn a lot of Sociology from him. Only 2 midterm exams and most of the questions come from lecture examples and Kyle makes sure you remember them because of his excellent teaching style and memes.

Kyle is the BEST professor at SFU, guaranteed. The thing that makes his lectures so great is that he finds ways to relate course content to everyday life, which makes it interesting. He is a very funny lecturer who LOVES memes. Tests are very fair, with no surprises at all. Two term papers are easy. Easiest A+ have ever earned.

Kyle is HILARIOUS! Such an amazing prof who is very personable with students! The marking however was BRUTAL! But that is the TA's fault, very inconsistent and would give zeroes for definitions that are exactly from lecture as she wanted it to fit her view. However Kyle was excellent! No final exam which is a plus

Kyle is such an amazing and hilarious prof. Attendance is not mandatory but it's definitely worth it to sit through a whole lecture with him, he relates class topics to things in the real life and makes it easier to understand (with a good sense of humour). Great semester but didn't have a good time with the TA

Kyle is an amazing professor. He made my 8 am class worth it, as for SA150: His tests are mostly composed of his lecture slides and specific examples that he uses and discusses within the class, so the lecture is a must. And also his papers are worth more than tests. He's very funny, lenient and accessible out of class. Would 100% recommend

Kyle is one of my favourite professors. He's got a great sense of humour and his lectures are super entertaining. He's very passionate about his discipline and doesn't read off his slides, it's all from his own intelligence which keeps you listening. 2 hour tutorials are eh, but my TA was great so it wasn't that bad. Take any class he teaches!!!

Kyle is super hilarious and made lectures super fun! His lecture slides were informative and kept my attention the entire time. I would suggest reading all the material he assigns because you will be tested on EVERYTHING. Super fair guidelines on assignments/tests. Although, two hour tutorials were not fun - get ready to speak up.

he's honestly a gem slides are primary source - treat textbook as supplementary reading does test on additional reading - not long / very interesting tries his best to connect with the students through memes hilarious + connects concepts to real life grading scheme is fair - grade depends on the TA eye opening class to society's norms

Kyle was an awesome prof! His lectures were funny, interactive and informative. He prepared us well for the tests, which I found fair. I was not sure about sociology before taking this course. Kyle has convinced me that it's a great field of study. I would definitely take another course with Kyle.

I really enjoyed Kyle's class. I found him to be very friendly and personable. The course was really interesting and made me think about issues in a different way. He is very passionate and you can see it in his teaching style. Would do another class with him!
kyle was awesome, he made his lecture super interesting, although I would suggest really studying hard on concepts for the mid terms!

Kyle was a great prof! He made lectures very interesting and was such a funny guy! The class was based on 2 papers and Midterm and Final. It is important to read the textbook to get good marks on the exams. Fairly an Easy A if you study well and have a good TA!
Passionate and funny. The class is easy enough but all depends on the T.A you get. My T.A was horrible but still enjoyed prof Willmott

Kyle is an awesome prof! His lectures are really engaging and very clear, but he does tend to go fast. There are no trick questions on his exams, everything is straight forward. Definetly would take his class again.

Kyle is a passionate professor who makes his lectures very engaging and relatable. I found that this helped to make the material easier to learn. Despite tutorials being 2 hours, they had a great impact on making sure the material learnt in lecture was understood well. I would recommend this class!

Hands down my favourite class this semester. Kyle made the lectures really fun and communicated the material effectively; I didnt even need to use the text book! Our Ta Gyuzel was also good& kept discussions interesting.I slacked off second term and barely tried but still managed to get an okay mark. This class has made me want to switch my major.

Kyle is an amazing prof!! He is genuinely enthusiastic about what he is teaching and is extremely educated on the subjects he talks about. Due to the fact it is a 4 credit course there is two appears, but they are laid out nicely and quite easy to understand. The mid term exam was VERY fair, everything was discussed in lecture and was major topics.
Benita's lecture content was useful and she was committed to the subject more than other instructors. She takes a social justice approach when teaching about society which I liked.

Way too hard for a 100 level course. Strong bias on her perspectives and opinions, long lectures with no powerpoint provided so make sure you don't skip and take notes. Basically anything from the whole textbook can be tested. Lots of theories that must be applied to almost everything.

Benita is by far the worst prof I've had so far in 3 years. Turned a seemingly interesting intro course into a horribly boring and extremely difficult class. Very close minded. Deliberately limited informationhelp that she offered and allowed TA's to offer. Made a ridiculous criteria for assignments and tests. The list goes on and on... Avoid!!!

He was super unorganized and seems like he didn't know what he was talking about half the time. Lectures and textbook readings were unrelated. First half of class from lecture and second half was spent watching a movie. Interesting, but he rarely asked about it on exams. Most people leave after the lecture part. Hated going to tutorials.

Lectures are confusing even if you have background knowledge - focus on the names he mentions and their theories. Midterm is much harder than the final b/c it covers more chapters. Tests are based on the textbook and a little on the lectures. Tutorials can be a drag b/c most students don't care abt the material, but participation is 15% so go.

Lectures are very confusing, and not essential to passing the course. He says "supplementing the chapter" yet you are left confused after going to class. Theres a movie every single lecture that are somewhat interesting, yet very little questions are asked on tests. Term paper is a joke, three drafts of non sense. Yet prof seemed really nice.

2 hour class, 1st hour is a lecture and 2nd is a film. Don't bother going to lecture, it's completely unrelated to the book. Just read the book and go to tutorial. Both midterm and final were multiple choice. There are some questions based off the films but you can usually find them online. Make sure to attend tutorials as it's worth 15%.
Not a good lecturer, its hard to follow his lectures as they are so boring and hes not that good at teaching. Take this class with a different prof

His lectures are quite dry and can often be confusing. He throws in a few jokes here and there but is often too quiet. Tests are a bit tough; harder than what you'd expect. Didn't learn much from his lectures. Read the textbook and go to tutorials and you're set.
Vague lecture notes
The lecture was really dry. On top of his dry lectures, he goes off topic and includes information that is not necessary for the midterm or the final.

Makes the lectures interesting with a mix of slides and films. Does skim through some material, so you'll need to go through the text thoroughly. Could do with more clarity with the synthesis. Multiple choice exams are fairly tough. Would have preferred written! Has a good sense of humour. Decent professor overall for a first year course.

He taught for one hour using brief slides, then used the second hour to watch a film. Lectures are helpful, but only skim what is needed for the exam. Attendance and write ups count a lot towards the grade. Don't skip tutorial or you will lose 2%. Exams are mostly fair, but a handful of questions are quite difficult. In the end, hard work pays off.
He is a very good teacher! To pass the course you need to attend to the tutorials and read the book for the exam!
Lots of work, but she really cares. Always gives excellent and thorough feedback. Very cool, admirable person. Very understanding and fair.
Best prof I ever met. Nobody can beat Cathy!

Take Baran. He's very clear cut and tells you whats expected for the exams (The TAs are responsible for guiding the final essay). At the beginning of the course I didn't think I would really understand the major theories and other main sociological concepts but at the course end I knew much more than I expected myself to know.
Baran is good and seems passionate and interested in material they teach. Easy to do well on exams if you review and understand concepts. Participation in tutorial is part of the mark. Good TAs.

one of the most chill profs u can find in sfu and they really tries to accomodate to every student needs. exams are not hard at all if you go through the concepts in lectures. shout out to patrick for being a great ta as well cuz he explains a lot more of the concepts in tutorials which helped me a lot for studying.
Baran… slay!!! The lectures are so fun but also rich and packed with interesting way of using sociology to explain life!!
i love them fr

Baran is so fun, caring and puts so much effort in each lecture. Lectures are packed with information, but they share slides in advance that really helps  following them in the lecture. Tutorials are also super fun! I like how real life examples are used making the course material less abstract and easily understandable.

Baran was quite opinionated in his lectures and it was pretty clear that he was showing bias when discussing certain topics. This was one of the main drawbacks of the course, as I believe instructors in a professional setting should aim to present information in a more neutral and balanced manner, especially when teaching a subject like sociology.

Baran truly wants you to succeed in the course, and their passion for Sociology radiates in every lecture. For tutorials, show up to each one, ask questions, and contribute to lock in those participation marks. When studying for the exams, I would say to use the textbook effectively, focus on the information that overlaps with the slides.

Baran patiently answered every question I asked about the lectures, exams and the paper through the term. I never felt though he looked down on someone if they asked many questions. They really care about students succeed and they do care about students understanding of the course.

Prof goes on to ramble on random things during lectures, so he doesn't even end up covering the entire slide deck for each lecture. No point in going to the lectures or doing the readings, as you can just study from the lecture slides for tests. Tests are easy and nothing to worry about. Better to connect with TAs as they do all the grading.

Baran is overall a cool person & passionate about sociology. their lectures are made to be relatable for gen z & full of content so i'd recommend going. the extra readings are a bit long. exams are written so you really have to understand the concepts to do well but they're worth as much as the essay & participation which helps balance it out

Baran rocks!!! He's so passionate about what he teaches and cares about the wellbeing of students. He took time to clearly explain assignments. The lectures were always fun, at times packed with many concepts and theories, so took so much energy and commitment to absorb it all. Tutorial participation was 20% so ensure to show up and participate.

Love Baran! Their lectures are packed with info, so be prepared to take a lot of notes. The TA's are also amazing! Tutorial participation is with 20% so be sure to show up and contribute! Marked by a midterm, 1 paper, and final. Baron seems very passionate and kind, would recommend taking their class!

Very knowledgeable and good at explaining the course concepts. if you hate the neoliberal ideology of academia then he's such a breath of fresh air. unfortunately the class is 200 people so it's hard to interact w them directly, but he was a great prof. i'd suggest taking a course w smaller ppl to rlly get the best of his teaching.

Good at giving feedback, not too difficult, but way too opinionated. Spoke so heavy on his political views and got very carried away at times, it got super unprofessional. Unnecessarily spoke about these things and it ruined a lot of lectures because he got off track. He was helpful in answering questions about tests, but not professional.
Great lectures! Very informative yet engaging at the same time. He has a great sense of humour and is very passionate about what he teaches.

Baran is an amazing prof who makes an effort to connect with his students! He explains everything clearly, but there's a LOT of content in each class so taking notes can be difficult. The only thing that sucked about this class was the TA's grading... no one understood why we got marks deducted even though we answered everything right. Slay Baran!!
Baran is one of the best SFU has to offer. His lectures are extremely engaging and he makes all concepts and expectations clear. Give this guy a raise!

I love this sociology class! Baran makes the lectures relevant and interesting to learn. He posts PDF's of the slides and textbook reading is not horrible. Attendance is not mandatory but for tutorial it is. Participation in the tutorial is necessary for a good grade so I recommend attending lectures to participate in conversations for tutorial.
Baran is the nicest prof!!! if you want to like sociology, take his course!!

I visited Baran a few times during office hours in the semester or emailed them. Each time they provided very helpful feedback! They seem to be really caring about learning and writing skills of students (I really appreciate all tips on writing). Definitely recommend! Their lecturing content related a lot to my real life experiences.

GREAT CLASS+PROF! Don't buy the textbook! Biggest waste of my $50, didn't touch it and got an A-. He was really interesting lectures and his exams are pretty straight forward. If you put in effort you'll get at least a B+. Make sure you get advice from your TA and talk in tutorial! I think participation was 15% easy mark, pretty easy course

Boring, boring professor. What could be an interesting course with lots of interesting supplemental material got made into two hours of him standing at the front of the class talking. No slides or anything.. just heading titles. Tutorials were a lot of effort and relaly not interesting if you don't care. Readings were pretty difficult.

Good professor, good lectures, good tutorials. My TA (Chris) was always good for some interesting tutorials. Take down good notes during lecture (that are recorded if you need to re-listen to them) and you will do well in this class.
REALLY GOOD PROFF! recorded lectures, not mandatory to go to class if you listen to the lectures online. Test are simple and straight foward directly from his lectures!! Easy class
textbook useless don't buy.  listen to recorded lectures @ home.  don't need to go to lectures, just go to tutorials. no surprises on exams and papers.  get maureen as a T.A., shes so awesome!

OMG AWESOME PROF! RECORDED lectures are a total charm.  No need to go to lectures. Just take notes at home, with an outline provided on webct.  There are no surprises.  W/e is said in the recorded lectures is gonna be in his exams. DO NOT BUY THE TEXTS! ITS USELESS! Tutorial's like a 2nd class (tutorial is mandatory tho). overall great lecturer.
Lecture notes recorded, which is a major plus. Exams are straight forward, study from lecture notes and you will do well. Overall, great prof - interesting lectures
Very passionate prof. Incredibly specific and detailed.
Talks quickly. Recorded lectures are a charm. Funny guy and is clearly passionate about the subject. Fair tests, no point in reading the book. Definitely one of my favourite profs.
He's an excellent lecturer.  Attendance in lectures and good note-taking is a necessity.  Both the midterm and final were easy and came directly from the lectures.

One of my favourite classes and profs; he gives the best and most interesting lectures. Completely fair. Recommend this course/prof to anyone. And I swear he looks and sounds like an older version of Billie Joe Armstrong from Green Day! Wierd

Great prof!! Don't need the course book but need the tutorial book. Covers all material in class. Super interesting really clear. A GPA booster only if your interested. Definitely going to take another class with him if i get the chance too!! Tutorials are exhausting and the only down point to the class
great proof. I took this class as one of my major requirements and now i'm thinking to minor sociology. I really enjoyed being in his class. fair exams

He was nice enough to e-mail notes to everyone and record his lecture. By the end of the course I could not force myself to sit in that 2 hour lecture. Just listen and fast forward as needed. Did not use the text book, just borrow or photocopy; he covers all the theory needed in class anyway.
Amazing. One of the best professors I have ever had, if not the best. His speaking skills are remarkable. He makes me want to major in Sociology. Take this course with him!

Here's what you need to do to ace his class: I attended all his lectures and took detailed notes but thats not so important cuz his lectures are recorded. You MUST listen to his lectures online, they help a lot. Forget the text book, I wouldn't even buy it, he may toss in a couple of questions from the book but thats it.
Just like the way he talks. Note taking is important.

Good prof overall. Talks really fast though, but he uses lots of examples to make his point clear. Tutorial is totally unrelated to lecture, like a 2nd course really. Overall, a very interesting course for 4 units, I'd recommend it if you're looking for B-Soc, but be sure to take it with Ken Fish as prof.

Talks really fast for note taking; interesting course in all, however he takes really long to cover one topic. The lectures were 2 hours long, kind of hard to sit through when there wasn't any breaks at first. Tutorials were like taking another course. They were also 2 hours long. Material from tutorial was unrelated to lectures.

No need to attend lec - recordings are all u need. Notes provide SKELETON knowledge- truly an intro course. Prof takes forever on one topic, but he is sardonic and entertaining though and it is VERY easy to understand material.. so good for all, SA majors or not. Tutorials totally unrelated to examinable material - like a 2nd course, almost.
Fantastic prof!  Clear, knowledgeable, and sexy.

3 hour lectures are pretty brutal, as were the midterm and final. A lot of memorization. The class was interesting if you sat down to think about some of the ideas brought up but none of the coursework got into that. Makes you think, but thinking won't necessarily boost your GPA in this case.
Great class. Lectures are quite good but the exams are crazy tough, they're also based on his lecture notes so you have to go to class.
I really enjoyed this class, engaging lectures are very interesting. There is a lot of material covered so be prepared to work hard and beware of the exams. Overall I would recommend this prof.

MIDTERM and FINAL were brutal. multiple choice was HORRIBLE the questions were completley irrelevant and very difficult even the TA's said they were brutal but the written was awesome and easy to ace. My TA made the class. Ken was nice but the lecture was not engaging and it was easier to listen to the recordings rather than him
becarefull, this course isn't a GPA booster, his TA's are pretty bad as well

Cool Prof, this was my favourite course of the semester. 2 exams, non-accumulative, all based on his lectures. very fun class, just make sure you attend, and take good notes (audio recording helps) AWESOME CLASS

Good class and good professor.  Ken knows his stuff well.  His lectures are very informative. TAs are also friendly and helpful. The exams and writing assignments are fair.  Attendance is a must as he tests you based on the things he says in lecture.  To do well in his class you need to listen to him carefully and take good notes.
He is awesome with his lectures, really knows his stuff. He's fair too, won't test you on stuff he hasn't talked about. Textbooks were pretty much useless for this class.
Ken was really nice and had some great TAs working with him as well. His topics were engadging (which was great because the lecture was three hours long).

He's a good teacher overall. His midterm is easy but final is hard. Also, for students who learned english as a second language or third, you might have trouble answering some of his exam questions so be careful.

Fish is very well organized. I recommend going to class because he makes the course material very comprehensible and then you know what you HAVE TO read. Not exactly a passionate lecturer but gets across the message.
... A fountain of opinion!
Ken is a great prof. He talks really fast so you either have to be able to write or type fast or take good notes quickly. Paper was hard. Exams weren't too bad.

Talk about dull and nowhere near as easy as he should be for a 100 level course. Dr Fish is SO boring and his mid term, paper and final are not fun. I would recommend this class with Ann Travers, everyone loves her.
No Comments

If you're lazy and you happen to have this dude as your professor, stay away. Midterm and Final were brutal, had to write your own notes during lectures. But if you're really interested in this course then he's a pretty good professor.
Fantastic instructor! You've got to take good notes, though, and stay awake for everything. But he's very interested in the material, knows it well, and seems to take real pleasure in teaching.

Great to look at and listen to, in that he's not your typical old prof., he dresses well and is quite articulate.  True:  doesn't use power point and YOU must  take meticul. notes, but he did introduce overhead projection this term, which helped to keep subject matter organized and perusable. Tries to be neutral, but sounds like a lefty. Funny, too

His hand writing is bad  ... he don't use powerpoint and this is not WebCT course ... so ... u have to pay attention in his lecture and never miss a class ... mt is easly .. final is fair too ... read the text book as well as his note. TAKE GOOD NOTES

good prof. kinda cute. doesn't write down notes which can be kinda hard sometimes but not too bad. you can tell he's interested in the course not all bored of it like some of the half-dead profs. plus the whole cute thing.
Really cool prof. Lectures with care not to reveal his ideology or at least "broadcast it". Very good at speaking and teaching in a lecture format. There's not much work in this class though...
A very good speaker.. makes it easy to sit thru 2 hour lectures.. clearly presents info so that you learn the material while he's presenting it.. youthful and, at times, comedic
He's such a cool teacher. Very clear and to the point. His lectures are interesting and at times funny. He's also pretty good looking for a teacher.
One of the best profs I've had, very clear, good notes, makes helpful analogies. Good course for sure...

Her lectures are just a long document she reads off of. Hard to understand and confusing. This was a first year course but felt harder than third year courses I've taken. Expects students to read her mind despite any clear explanation of the course content. Helps if you have a good TA. Would avoid this class if i were you!!!

I think she needs you to learn how to read her mind if you decide to take courses with her. Literally a farce - she never gives clear expectations and deducts marks without any reasons. The lecture notes are full of symbols that can be only understood by her. Even if you study everything she can still find ways to fail you with a whim. AVOID HER!

The grading was based solely on pop quizzes and tests (2 midterms and a final), which gave little opportunity to actively demonstrate knowledge of the material. She was unclear about what she expected of the class, and it showed when the class average for the first midterm was barely over 50%. For an intro-level course, it was very disappointing.
don't take this class with her

Agnes seems like she would be a nice person in the real world, but she is neither a kind nor a skilled professor. She thinks lecture ppts are "trickery" and posts incomprehensible Word docs as 'lecture notes'. The average for a 1st year open-book midterm was 57% (laughably low), which she blamed on our home distractions. Avoid @ all costs.

Agnes is the worst professor I have ever had at SFU by far. She was extremely disorganized and did nothing to prepare you for exams. Her notes covered only 10% of the chapter and were horribly out of touch from the textbook-- often contradicting each other. I understand everything went online and that it is a new environment... but at least try.

Agnes is by far one of the worst instructors I had at SFU. During lectures, she read off her notes and not explaining the concepts. I had to read the textbook and learn what was important to know for the whole semester. The TA's helped but it was not enough. Agnes was extremely unorganized instructor and her exams were pure writing.

Agnes had an extremely unorganized course set up for the semester. Nothing was ever clear about midterms and final. During lecture/office hours she would read notes she posted not really explaining anything in further detail. It really depends on your TA how this course goes for you, that will the only person teaching anything properly.

During this semester, she just read her notes in lectures. Her notes were useless because there were so many dashes and arrows that only this professor can understand. If you take any course with her, you have to study that course alone or only with your TA. Even she doesn't want to say how many questions on an exam like saying "It will be 5-10".
